text: Ogden is a municipality of about 750 people in Memphrémagog Regional County Municipality in the Estrie region of Quebec, Canada. It includes the hamlets of Tomifobia (formerly Smith's Mills) and Graniteville. ==Demographics== ===Population=== Population trend:Statistics Canada: 1996, 2001, 2006, 2011 census {| class="wikitable" |- ! Census ! Population ! Change (%) |- | 2011 | 770 | 1.0% |- | 2006 | 762 | 0.0% |- | 2001 | 762 | 0.9% |- | 1996 | 769 | 3.1% |- | 1991 | 746 | N/A |} ===Language=== Mother tongue (2011) {| class="wikitable" |- ! Language ! Population ! Pct (%) |- | French only | 365 | 47.1% |- | English only | 375 | 48.4% |- | English and non-official language | 5 | 0.7% |- | Both English and French | 15 | 1.9% |- | Other languages | 15 | 1.9% |} == See also == * List of municipalities in Quebec ==References== ==External links== * Category:Municipalities in Quebec Category:Incorporated places in Estrie
title: Ogden, Quebec
